intro: Psychotria nigra var. nigra, commonly known as the black Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. The plant has been used in traditional medicine and has cultural significance in some indigenous communities.
